review:
Satisfied!!!

Sometimes you take your decisions on your instincts rather than advices and you hit bang on. Buying Marq has been a similar experience,there were no reviews on this particular model as it was launched during the sale day but at 36k(includes additional warranty)it was too lucrative to be missed. Here’s my experience after 10 days of observation-

Delivery-
Faster than expected. The delivery period was 14 days , I got it on the 4th day.

Installation-
The Jeeves technician was really helpful as installing the TV on WALL Mount at my home was little complicated but he did a real good job on it.

Service-
Again the same technician had visited when I had requested a service visit as I had some doubts about the picture quality and he helped with the settings which improved the picture quality much better.

Picture quality -
Good but could be better. One may not find the same effects as a Sony or Samsung or Lg but I would say Marq has done a pretty good job considering the price point and other factors.

Sound-
To the mark, in-fact better than I had expected. No need to have an additional sound bar.

Connectivity-
Was pretty smooth and had no issues at all.

HD and 4K content-
On the set top box watching HD content is really good but SD is a disappointment. HD on internet with decent speeds is just fine. Regarding UHD4K, as far my knowledge goes our we still don’t have much content on our set-top box and if you plan to watch it on internet one needs to have at-least 25 mbps speed to see the true effects. Even Netflix which has UHD content is unable to show until you have very high speed internet at home.Unfortunately I don’t have it so I cannot comment on it yet.

Final verdict-
If you are a common layman like me who does not go into too much integrities of picture quality,sound and other features this is just the right product. Also note that at this price this is definitely a steal and it also helpful if you plan to change your TV faster to keep up with the new technologies in the market.

Pros -
4K video and Sound is above average,
55inch size does great job at this price

Cons -
This has flipkart based Android, not stock referred in description
Google Chromecast claimed as inbuilt is also rigged, does not allow streaming from apps (Netflix etc) that Flipkart does not want to be used.
Only has and allow installing PAID apps from google and Hotstar ..etc
Free apps (streaming/ storage/ sharing) does not show available to install, including Google Photos, Amazon prime.
Only Hoststar/ YouTube are allowed as Video streaming apps, Netflix installs but stops with error enforced by flipkart android code.
Takes almost 2-3 min to power on as it boots like your android phone
Slow processing of menu selections and app loading with 100Mbps Airtel Fiber network seems 2.5 GB RAM does not help much.

Conclusion -
Wont recommend to buy this, if you looking for a smart TV with android due to rigged code for some sites.
Linux based normal smart TVs have no option to make changes, but you get what you see and they perform much faster and reliably.

I did a fair bit of research for almost a month in search of a new TV ever since my 8 year old 40" Sony started showing issues. I knew sooner or later I have to buy a new TV. I did market research both online and in local shops before buying this one. Here are some of my conclusions.

1. Well known brands such as Sony, Lg and Samsung cost almost double or even triple the price of budget TVs
2. Even though they cost much more, none of them are offering warranty above 1 year , which in my opinion makes no sense.
3. Sure, the branded TVs are brighter and vivid than budget TVs, but its negligible. You have keep it side by side to see the difference.
4. Extended warranty purchase for branded TVs are very costly.

Thus I concluded budget TVs made perfect sense, but the issue was I cannot verify in person the real performance of these Tvs, Since they where online only products. I had to rely on online reviews and ratings to make my decision. After two weeks of usage I don't regret my purchase. Let me explain my point.

1. This TV have enough brightness to view without glares in a well lit room. (Background light is set to 100% by default).
2. Color reproduction is good and I had no issues viewing any type of videos.
3. Android certified Smart TV, with voice assistant is a delight to use.
4. 10 bit HDR (1.07 B Colors) is a feature many budget TVs miss.
5. Good inbuilt speakers (Dolby Digital).
6. Better processor and Ram specification than competitors.
7. DLED which is better than ELED.

Although Flipkart have done an excellent job, I have a few minor complaints.

1. Floor stands provided was not as shown in pictures, It is just a U shaped silver colored rod with mounting points which looks ugly.
2. TV takes its own time to boot ( around 1 min), but it can be understood since its Smart TV, I think I'll get used to it.
3. Smart TV responsiveness could have been better, Navigating through apps are not as smooth as I wished for.

Overall a very good purchase, My main concern is about the after sales service, which I am yet to encounter, let's see.

Thank you,
Flipkart

Love the 4K picture clarity. Best TV in this price range. Apps can be sideloaded easily via USB. (NETFLIX is not supported hence doesn't work. Same goes for Amazon Prime. I already have a Firestick so no problem at all.) Speakers on the TV are good enough but if you want good home theater experience, it's a good idea to invest in a Soundbar with good bass. The TV only has optical sound output option... So 3.5mm jack or Stereo Out or HDMI ARC is NOT available, ensure if you are buying Soundbar or 5.1 speaker system, it does have an optical input option. I've tried playing 4k 2160p HDR movies by connecting my Hard Disk and the native media player does a brilliant job at that. People complaining about blacks or Dark scenes performance on the panel are just too demanding...I find no issue here... Screen quality is actually more than you can ask for (specially in this killer budget) One more aspect this TV wins at is the official YouTube app... Playing UHD content on YouTube native app is really enjoyable and easy. (on my Amazon Firestick I was using an alternate app for YouTube and the experience was not that great.) The UI is also fast and the RAM management is adequate. TV starts faster than many similar range offerings in the segment... iFFalcon, Mi etc. About the extended warranty, you should definitely TAKE the 2 years extended warranty being offered by Jeeves as it gives you peace of mind for atleast 3 years, given that Marq is a fairly newer brand. The Smart remote which is Bluetooth enabled looks & feels quite premium and is so easy to use. Well, lastly, the 55inch panel looks quite overwhelming when watching any 4k content and is simply mind blowing.

If I talk about this TV so I would like to discuss some pros and cons of it.

Pros:
1. Dolby sound is better and give you a surround experience.
2. Day light images really come alive and give a nice contrast and clarity.
3. It comes with Media player which plays most of the audio and video formats.
4. In built YouTube app allows you to play online video contents easily.

Cons:
1. Screen has the white spots which doesn't seem pretty good when TV goes complete in black Transition.
2. Night movie scene or darker images do not go pretty well that it should be.
3. Inbuilt media player do not play DTS surround audio and MXlayer and VLC etc. not supportable and it is certified android but not all apps you can find on it. there is very few apps you can install and always apps go into the pending mode which is really irritating.

Verdict:

This the best budget 4K TV in this range. you could go for it but if you have higher budget you can consider another one if your budget allows you.

lagg noticed while playing though mobile Chrome cast, YouTube works pretty fine, unable to detect my mobile when Connected through USB port.. Coming to the installation and service quality its A+.. They responded pretty well and also has taken care in mounting the TV with good placement on wall and without any flaws. There is some distracting patches probably screen backlight bleeding on top of the screen left side mostly while the picture is black and so it is becoming difficult to enjoy the darker scenes at nigh especially..this is something which us annoying and I don't think we can enjoy watching night time and darker scenes. I would recommend the TV for this price point and I got it for 36k with 3 years of warranty so it's actly a deal breaker for me and anyone who is getting for this price I will definitely recommend considering the other good feature of the TV except the dark scene display issue.

Let me go into positives

1) Nice display for the price you pay.. uniform brightness due to DLED, decent contrast (not comparing to product priced twice as much), good colour reproduction (8 bit panel unlike Mi which is 10 bit but the cost difference justifies it)
2) Easy to understand menu and dual remote makes thing easy to navigate (even my parents don't face much problem)
3)Side ports makes accessing ports really easy (i dont have much space to turn tv around each time as you see in pic)
4) Decent sound bar with loudness above expectation (dont expect Home theatre, although I have2.1 speakers I rarely need to use them)
5) Really fast installation by jeeves and excellent product demonstration...pleased with the experience

Now the cons..
1) Slow to start even with 2gb ram. My lappie with SSD boots up faster than this TV
2) Playstore has limited app support (I dont mind as I dont use netflix)
3) True HDR is missing (8 bit panel just cant do it .. sorry)

All in all I recommend the product for sheer value of money... In 2-3 years anyways QLED will takeover the market. So can be purchased for the interim period.

Well - I believe what we call the product is the physical experience of the product plus the behavior of the associated entities.
If I take the product alone - It is simply superb! A beautiful, well built, feature loaded TV at a very competitive price. There are some things which could be improved from the Android store - such as Prime Video, Netflix support, etc., which I believe is in progress and shall be addressed soon.

Pros
- Excellent picture quality, at par with all the premium brands such as Samsung, Sony, etc.
- Dolby Certified sound quality which would light up the room
- 4k upscaling is one of the best in the business
- Enough ports to fit in all your accessories

Cons
- There needs a bit more training for the service engineers (Since it was my friend who came to install, which I never knew in advance, I was relieved a lot)
- Lack of support for popular apps (This should be addressed in the future)
- Slowness in boot up, almost 6-8 seconds

Overall (due to the installation experience I had), I can give only 4/5 rating. I was planning to give 5/5.

If you want to get a headache everytime you watch, go ahead with this junk.

Utterly disappointed with the after-sales service provided by Jeeves which apparently is partner for Flipkart. I had a pretty disappointing experience. My Television I purchased it 2 years ago and suddenly it showed some sort of issues with the screen. The screen had got dull all of a sudden. Since at the time of purchase we bought an extended warranty of 2 years, I contacted Jeeves to get my television repaired. To my surprise, the technician who came to attend my television ended up damaging my product even more. Since my issue wasn’t resolved, Jeeves personnel came and took my tv claiming they’re taking it for repairs of the product. To point out some facts, the number which they mention on the extended warranty section of Jeeves website is legit a scam since they redirect you back to Flipkart and not answer you properly. To sum up my experience, I did not get my TV yet, and also I don’t expect fraudsters like Jeeves to even return my product anytime soon. So the product will last you for couple of years, depending on your luck. Since these brands aren’t reputed and backed up by Flipkart, doesn’t give them the right to cheat consumers. So it’s totally on your risk that you buy this product. Hope my review will help some innocent buyer who intends to spend their hard earned money on such a cheap, low class brand and product.
